channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Two Dead After Being Struck By Pickup Truck in Downtown Manhattan
item.description: At least 11 people who were celebrating the July 4 holiday were struck by the truck on the Lower East Side, the authorities said.

item.title: Live Updates: Labour Party Wins U.K. Election in a Landslide
item.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain’s next prime minister, ending 14 years of Conservative government. Rishi Sunak, the outgoing prime minister, apologized for his party’s campaign performance.

item.title: Rishi Sunak may have lost his $177,000 Prime Minister gig, but a multimillion-dollar corporate payday awaits the man richer than King Charles
item.description: Book deals, speaking engagements, and a return to finance will add to Sunak’s massive net worth.

item.title: Don’t Doubt NATO. It Saved My People.
item.description: NATO’s intervention against Serbia’s campaign against Kosovo set the tiny country up for independence.

item.title: Civics is becoming a 21st-century business skill
item.description: The very skills that formed the great experiment of democracy are the same skills that lead to breakthrough ideas and continued economic growth.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl Churns Toward Mexico With Renewed Force
item.description: The storm, now back to Category 3 force, is expected to make landfall in Mexico on Friday morning, having left a trail of destruction across the Caribbean.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo, Euro 2024 and the Problem With Too Much Fame
item.description: The soccer superstar’s trip to Euro 2024 has been marked by pitch invaders and uninspiring performances. As fans try to get close, his team can’t seem to let go.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Tesla recoups all its year-to-date losses after adding a staggering $150bn in market cap in just 3 days: ‘Worst is in the rear view mirror’
item.description: Investor faith in Tesla's once busted-growth story appears to have returned after a dire first-half that saw it become the butt of jokes.

item.title: Iran’s Presidential Candidates: Who Are They?
item.description: Two candidates face off in Iran’s runoff election on Friday after neither secured enough votes to win in the first round. Here’s what you need to know about their positions and background.

item.title: Iran’s Presidential Candidates: Who Are They?
item.description: Two candidates face off in Iran’s runoff election on Friday after neither secured enough votes to win in the first round. Here’s what you need to know about their positions and background.

item.title: China’s BYD expands its reach into Southeast Asia as it inaugurates first EV plant in Thailand
item.description: The new factory in Rayong, south of Bangkok, was built in just 16 months and has an annual production capacity of 150,000 vehicles.

item.title: Iran Voters Face Stark Choice in Competitive Presidential Runoff
item.description: For the first time in years, the outcome is difficult to predict, and could be decided by how many people end their boycotts and participate in the vote.

item.title: Can the Labour Party Bring Back Britain’s Green Groove?
item.description: The new government, widely expected to be led by Labour, has pledged to fast-track a green energy transition. It will face big challenges.

item.title: Elon Musk ghosts India on new Tesla factory investment
item.description: Musk’s team hasn’t made any further inquiries with officials in New Delhi after the billionaire postponed a visit to India in late April, sources said.
